title: Few-shot Learning in Computer Vision: Dual Metric Network Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic calculus, matrix operations, and graph theory, along with Python programming skills
context.additional_context: Students Perform Advanced Tasks Solving Computer Vision Problems Through Mathematical Modeling, Integrating Digital Device-Based Practice with Theoretical Instruction. Final Assessment Consists of Project Deliverables (Implemented Learning Models and Analysis Reports).

learning_goals: Explaining the core principles of few-shot learning and computer vision applications from a mathematical perspective
Designing and implementing classification models based on dual-metric domains (graph neural networks + geometric algebra)
One can explain optimization techniques that reduce prediction bias by applying complementary metric learning algorithms
One can quantitatively evaluate and analyze model performance using public benchmark datasets
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
